meanings.sent1: She dove headlong into the pool, making a big splash.
meanings.sent2: The child ran headlong towards the playground, full of excitement.
meanings.sent3: The puppy chased its tail headlong, looking quite silly.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed headlong over the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The car sped headlong down the hill, thrilling the passengers.

meanings.definition: Done or undertaken quickly and impulsively; rash.
meanings.sent1: His headlong decision to quit his job surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The headlong rush to finish the project led to mistakes.
meanings.sent3: Her headlong shopping spree left her with regret and many bags.
meanings.sent4: The headlong race to the finish line was intense and chaotic.
meanings.sent5: The headlong pursuit of fame often leads to disappointment.
